column1: At risk user1 with access to key services within lower2 and upper2 threshold by composite mode3, region, England, 2007 to 2013
Number of people with access within threshold
Percentage of people with access within threshold

1 The at risk users looks at particular social groups at risk of exclusion, e.g. for primary schools, the at risk users are children aged 5-10 known to be eligible for free school meals. Please see the guidance note for a full list of user groups.

2 The number and proportion of users in a local area who can access a service within set time limits. For further information on details on the lower and upper thresholds and how they are derived please see the guidance note.
3 The composite mode is produced by using the national mode split to weight the indicators by public transport, cycling and walking. Please see the guidance note for further information.
4 An at risk group is not measured for the Further Education service.
5 Public transport/walking data were not updated for 2012 due to a data quality issue. Please see 2013 statistical release or the guidance notes document for details.
6 A new method has been adopted in 2013 for the public transport/walking mode. Please see guidance notes document for details. The 2011 results have been recalculated on the new basis.
The figures in this table are outside the scope of National Statistics
